1�What would you like to know?Nothing. I'm sorry.About performance assessment.About Allied Tags.About temporary items.About Unions.
1�Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.
1�Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.
1�However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.
1�Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.
1�When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.
1�That is all.
1�Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.
1�There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.
1�However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.
1�That is all.
1�Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.
1�It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.
1�Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.
1�That is all.
1�Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we?Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.

1�In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called ??Unions.?? With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.
1�In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.

1�Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat.Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.

1�Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost.In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.
1�That is all.

1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.Let's here some more!

1�Now, listen close...
1�What took the two of you tho long, if I may athk? Hmmm?
1�So you're the ones behind all the strange incidents of late, eh?Not the least of all, the appearance of them Cavernous Maws?
1�A tad late to be givin' advice now, but you should've kept to the shadows.Marchin' in here, brazen as you please...you've gotta be either suicidal or stupid!
1�Well, looks to be your lucky day! Ahem!Liege Lord of the Dark Kindred, Supreme Commander of the Beastman Confederate, Great Unifier of Beastmen...
1�And Emperor-in-Waiting of All Vana'diel!The Lord of Shadows--that's to say, the Shadow Lord!
1�Mind you, insolence won't be abided in the presence of His Mightiness!Kneel in deference--nay, prostrate yourselves before--!
1�Is...is someone there?
1�The president readies himself for battle within the command post up ahead.Take this recommendation and make your way there immediately!
1�And take care to hold on to it!Gentle Tiger has replacements, but it's a long trek back to the Republic from here.
1�Now hurry,  !The president's life depends on you!
.!�How I hoped I wouldn't see you here...Zeid.
1�Zeid! What madness is this?What do you intend to do here?
1�Answer me!
1�Wait, Zeid!Are you truly so blind as to believe that...thing...is your captain?
1�Open your eyes!Zeid!!!
1�Damn! The fool really means to go through with it.
1� , your timing couldn't be better.The president will return from the field before long.
1�With Klara and Zeid both about, we can't be too careful.You make straight for the command post! I'll sweep the area to ensure they haven't cornered him elsewhere.
1�Mister President! Are you hurt?
1�Captain...?
1�What the--?
1�Zeid... So this...is what you meant...by...the truth.
1�Who goes there?
1�That mask...the renegade War Cloud!?
1�What business have you here?Answer me before I--!
1�Very well. Return to your posts, and report back to me at the first sign of enemy intruders.We must stay vigilant!
1�For the time being, it would seem.This makes twice you've saved my life, soldier.
1�And you shall go with him.
1�If you would atone for your heinous deeds, then do so with your actions.
1�Rotting away in that gaol cell will not bring back those that died by your hand.The least you can do is devote the rest of your days to those who still need you.
1�Is that not what Klara--the true Klara--would want of you?
1�Surely a part of her still remains...and this is why she seeks you out so doggedly time and again, even as the shadow consumes her soul...

1�Nicolaus and Five Moons, too, have languished in the disciplinary ranks long enough.As of this moment, consider the Mythril Musketeers reinstated by presidential decree.I command you to uncover the truth behind Klara Bester...together.

1�Excellent! As the Kindred go, so goes the Confederate...this will stay their advance for now.But this is no time to breathe easy. Ready the troops--we move camp north before the night is through.We show the fiends no quarter!
t.�Halt! Who goes there!?
1�Traitorous wench!You'll feel our blades!
1�All clear, Mister President, sir!
1�Lay down your blade, traitor!
e!�She's down below!After her!
1�Your Excellency, sir!I bring news from the field!
1�The Kindred commander has fallen! Our enemy breaks to the north!
1�Sir, yes sir!
1�...Pathetic.
1�Wait...that face. You were...?6But why ask the name of one about to die?En garde!
1�Heh...heh...heh...so the pu-ny mor-tal can put up a fight.No won-der this...wom-an...trusted you...heh...heh...
h!�Zeid!?
1�What is the meaning of this!?You draw your blade against the wrong opponent, Zeid!
1�Zeid!
1�What are you saying, Zeid?I am your--
1�Curses! Foiled again!
1�...Volker!
1�I seek only the truth. Nothing more.
1�...What vile fiend are you?
1�You...are no captain...no friend of mine.
1�Your Excellency...are you safe?
1�The words she spoke to me that day still burn in my mind: ??The next time we meet, it will not be me that stands before you...??
1�Her voice...the look in her eyes.I have no doubt. That was the Captain Klara I knew.
1�But that...thing...I crossed swords with just now...That was something else entirely...
1�That was not our captain.It was something...unholy.
1�Volker. You must seek out the truth.Find the true Captain Klara...if she even still lives.Now, I must return to face my sentence.
1�Mister President...?
1�Yes, sir...Mister President.
1�But before we do, we return to the capital.
1�Look at yourself, Volker.This is the second time in a span of days that you've borne the brunt of the Captain's dark wrath.You are in no condition to fight.
1�The Mythril Musketeers march as one, or march not at all.Rest up, friend. We strike forth when your wounds have healed, and not before.
1�General Doggvdegg! I fear I cannot comply with your orders.
1�Captain Jayramus. It seems to me we are vastly outnumbered.Are you certain this is a...wise undertaking?
1�Captain! Over yonder!
1�He appears to be accompanied not by the Royal Guards, sir, but the Iron Rams.
1�C-Captain! Is there naught we can do!?
1�Curses...
1�Long live Lord Excenmille!
1�Glory to House Aurchiat!
1�The Cardinal Stags are nowhere to be seen...Will they truly lure the enemy hither?
1�At the r-risk of sounding c-craven, are we not a little c-close to the enemy h-host?
1�(B-boss! Over there!)
1�Who go there!? Me know you there!
d?�Lone pointy-ear? Gwahahaha! Who wanting know?
1�Bwahaha... Bwahahahaha!Scrawny pointy-ear wanting fight General Doggvdegg? Not in thousand year!
y!�(D-did he died? Boss, you very strong! Me prepare victory toast--)
1�(B-boss! Situation very bad! M-more knight arrive!)
1�(B-but, boss... Me think bunch fighting at front not notice extra enemy...)
1�You would presume to issue orders to Rongelouts N Distaud?Your insolence knows no bounds, pigman!
1�Your payment for crimes committed against the Kingdom is long overdue, Doggvdegg, and we've come to collect it.
1�Witness you all this, Alphonimile?You can rest easy in the knowledge that the blood of your valiant line lives on strongly.
1�This be no place to bask overlong in victory. Forget not for an instant we stand in the heart of beastman territory.Let us return to base camp.
1�I am Phillieulais S Dieuffon, Royal Guard Lieutenant of the Kingdom of San d'Oria.If it please His Lordship Doggvdegg, I would have the honor of crossing blades with him in a duel.
1�Mi...milord...
1�For...forgive us, milord...The men...th-they... Your father...he...he... <Gasp>
1�Yes, Father.
1�F-Father!?
1�The knights are unfit to engage the enemy, let alone march!
1�Aye, I'm afraid... Deathly afraid...
1�Father shan't ever forgive me in this lifetime--nor the next--if I allow you lot to hobble to your deaths, shouting his name.
1�Now then, I believe a Kingdom unit is positioned on our left flank at present. What is their identity?
1� . You've done much for me already, yet I must request another favor.I need this message delivered to the Iron Rams:
1�The Cardinal Stags haven't the strength remaining to engage the Bloodwing Horde in the open field.
1�As such, we shall assume the role of bait and lure the beastmen into an ambush, where the Iron Rams lie in wait.
1�I'm depending on you,  . May the Goddess speed your way!
1�'Tis good to see you returned,  .
1�I fear the situation has taken an ill turn. Unable to master his desire for vengeance, Jayramus abruptly struck camp, taking all able men with him.They intend to strike back at the Orcs.
1�What of your end? I pray you've better news to offer me.
1�...That is heartening indeed. You have my gratitude,  .
1�And it would seem I owe Rahal and the others, too.I shall thank them at the earliest opportunity.
1�There is hope still. Let us pursue the Cardinal Stags and prevent them from engaging the enemy prematurely.
1�Thank you, Vinairy. This shall serve us well.
1�Your help is appreciated, Vinairy.I leave you the care of the wounded.
1�Shh... Hear you the guttural sound of Orcish chatter echoing off the cavern walls?The enemy encampment lies near.
1�Now's a good time to use the 3????.
1�Let's make haste,  .
1�Jayramus! Why do you stand there as if a statue!?Is this not the chance at retribution you so desired!?
